sessions.title: UGA T-Test 1
sessions.description: This test encapsulates the first thirty questions of the book offering questions of general mathematical logic of profit and loss and basic understanding of sets. The test lasts for two hours and offers thirty questions. There is no negative marking, and for each wrong attempt zero marks will be assumed, whereas for unattempted and correct answers, ome and four marks will be assumed respectively.

sessions.title: UGA S-Test 1
sessions.description: This test evaluates your understanding of fundamental concepts in mathematical logic, including truth tables, set theory operations, logical equivalences, functions, and related problem-solving skills. The marking scheme is preserved, +1 for unattempted, 0 for incorrect, and +4 for correct.
